Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
lite
<spelling> (Misspelling of "light", when used to mean "lightweight") A suffix denoting a scaled-down or crippled product, often designed to be distributed without charge, e.g. on a magazine {coverdisk}. An example is {pklite}.
(1995-10-06)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Lite \Lite\ (l[imac]t), a., adv., & n. Little. [Obs.] --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: -lith \-lith\ (-l[i^]th), -lite \-lite\ (-l[imac]t). suff. Combining forms fr. Gr. li`qos a stone; -- used chiefly in naming minerals and rocks. [1913 Webster]
lite adj : having relatively few calories; "diet cola"; "light (or lite) beer"; "lite (or light) mayonnaise"; "a low-cal diet" [syn: {light}, {low-cal}]
